trent o. wrote:

> Hello,
> 
> I'm trying to get JUnit to work happily with Ant within WSAD and I'm
> running into a problem.  I have a simple class and test to try to get
> this going.  When I run my Ant buildfile I get the following error:
> 
> Testcase: testConstructor took 0 sec
>       Caused an ERROR
> junit.framework.Assert: method assertEquals
> (Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V not found
> java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: junit.framework.Assert: method
> assertEquals(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V
> not found
>       at
> com.networksByteDesign.eMarket.inventory.salesItemTest.testConstructor
> (salesItemTest.java:89)
>       at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run
> (InternalAntRunner.java:262)
>       at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:234)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.AntFileRunner.execute
> (AntFileRunner.java:56)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.DefaultRunnerContext.execut
> eRunner(DefaultRunnerContext.java:428)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.core.DefaultRunnerContext.run
> (DefaultRunnerContext.java:479)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.ui.AntLaunchWizard$1.run
> (AntLaunchWizard.java:117)
>       at
> org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
> (ModalContext.java:98)
> 

> It seems to be having trouble finding a JUnit core method
> (assertEquals(String, String, String)) and I'm not sure why.  I have
> the junit.jar in my Classpath.

Which classpath? WSAD project build path? Ant compile-time class path? 
Ant run-time class path?

I suspect you are building your application with WSAD, then running the 
tests with Ant. That could be the problem: WSAD 5 ships with JUnit 3.7 
and with Ant you are likely using JUnit 3.8.1. Look in the WSAD plugins 
folder for junit.jar and see which version it is. Change your WSAD 
project to use the same junit.jar as you use with Ant -- preferably by 
creating a WSAD Classpath Variable.
